contents:
Pushing things to extremity just for fun. Relocati...


Indeed, the transaction cost may seem affordable to many. But my point was that it is not low enough to be considered comparable to that of changing companies in the free market.

I agree that emigration is currently still the best way to express dissents to the policies of the country that you reside.

What I'm saying is that there are ways to have an even more optimized result by reducing the barrier to entry of creating new countries and lowering the transaction cost of emigration.

The ultimate goal is to make it possible to change the jurisdiction one is under without relocating at all, in a way similar to changing one's internet provider.

But the practical measures to be taken now is to simply advocate for more autonomy and the right to secession for small regions.
